identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Test MK-0941 in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin (MK-0941-017)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase IIa, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Parallel-Arm Clinical Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of MK-0941 Compared to Sulfonylurea in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Therapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to test the effect of MK-0941 as add-on therapy for participants taking metformin for type 2 diabetes.

interventions.name: MK-0941
interventions.description: MK-0941 will be taken three times a day (TID), within 15 minutes before each meal. MK-0941 will be titrated to a maximally effective dose. The treatment period will be 6 weeks.

interventions.name: Glimepiride
interventions.description: Glimepiride will be taken once a day (QD) in the morning, within 15 minutes before the breakfast meal. Glimepiride will be titrated to a maximally effective dose. The treatment period is 6 weeks.

interventions.name: Metformin
interventions.description: The study will include an up to 4-week metformin dose titration/dose stabilization period. Once a participant has reached the maximum tolerated dose of metformin \[(i.e., ≥1500 mg/day and ≤2550 mg/day (or ≤3000 mg/day, where the maximum dose of metformin per the local label is 3000 mg/day)\], the participant should remain on the same metformin dose throughout the study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 6 in 24-hour Weighted Mean Glucose
primaryOutcomes.description: Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) is a measure of the amount of glucose in the blood over a period of 24 hours. The WMG was derived from multiple glucose values collected during both fasting and post-meal periods. The "weighted" mean was used to avoid over-representation of post-meal glucose values.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced One or More Episodes of Hypoglycemia (Symptomatic or Asymptomatic)
primaryOutcomes.description:
Hypoglycemic episodes are defined as either a fingerstick glucose

measurement of ≤70 mg/dL \[3.9 mmol/L\] with or without symptoms or symptomatic hypoglycemia.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient has type 2 diabetes mellitus
* Between the ages of 18 and 70

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient has a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus or ketoacidosis.
* Patient is on a weight loss program and is not in the maintenance phase or is taking weight loss medication.
* Patient has had surgery within 30 days of starting the study or has planned major surgery during the study

groups.title: MK-0941
groups.description: Participants receive MK-0941 5 mg or 10 mg tablets, orally, TID and placebo tablets matching glimepiride 1 mg or 2 mg, orally, QD for 6 weeks. Up-titration and down-titration of the dose could occur to achieve optimal individual glucose control. In addition, all participants received a maximum tolerated dose of metformin \[(i.e., ≥1500 mg/day and ≤2550 mg/day (or ≤3000 mg/day, where the maximum dose of metformin per the local label is 3000 mg/day)\], after a 4-week dose titration/dose stabilization period.

groups.title: Glimepiride
groups.description: Participants receive glimepiride 1 mg or 2 mg tablets, orally, QD and placebo tablets matching MK-0941 5 mg or 10 mg, orally, TID for 6 weeks. Up-titration and down-titration of the dose could occur to achieve optimal individual glucose control. In addition, all participants received a maximum tolerated dose of metformin \[(i.e., ≥1500 mg/day and ≤2550 mg/day (or ≤3000 mg/day, where the maximum dose of metformin per the local label is 3000 mg/day)\], after a 4-week dose titration/dose stabilization period.

measures.title: Mean 24-Hour Weighted Mean Glucose at Baseline
measures.description: Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) is a measure of the amount of glucose in the blood over a period of 24 hours. The WMG was derived from multiple glucose values collected during both fasting and post-meal periods. The "weighted" mean was used to avoid over-representation of post-meal glucose values.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Week 6 in 24-hour Weighted Mean Glucose
outcomeMeasures.description: Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) is a measure of the amount of glucose in the blood over a period of 24 hours. The WMG was derived from multiple glucose values collected during both fasting and post-meal periods. The "weighted" mean was used to avoid over-representation of post-meal glucose values.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The full analysis set (FAS) population included all randomized participants who had efficacy measurements at baseline or a post-randomization visit).

groups.title: MK-0941
groups.description: Participants receive MK-0941 5 mg or 10 mg tablets, orally, TID and placebo tablets matching glimepiride 1 mg or 2 mg, orally, QD for 6 weeks. Up-titration and down-titration of the dose could occur to achieve optimal individual glucose control. In addition, all participants received a maximum tolerated dose of metformin \[(i.e., ≥1500 mg/day and ≤2550 mg/day (or ≤3000 mg/day, where the maximum dose of metformin per the local label is 3000 mg/day)\], after a 4-week dose titration/dose stabilization period.

groups.title: Glimepiride
groups.description: Participants receive glimepiride 1 mg or 2 mg tablets, orally, QD and placebo tablets matching MK-0941 5 mg or 10 mg, orally, TID for 6 weeks. Up-titration and down-titration of the dose could occur to achieve optimal individual glucose control. In addition, all participants received a maximum tolerated dose of metformin \[(i.e., ≥1500 mg/day and ≤2550 mg/day (or ≤3000 mg/day, where the maximum dose of metformin per the local label is 3000 mg/day)\], after a 4-week dose titration/dose stabilization period.

analyses.groupDescription: Using a standard deviation of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of at least 65 participants per treatment group would be required to have an 80% power to detect a true difference of 12.5 mg/dL between MK-0941 and glimepiride as measured by change from baseline in 24-hour WMG at Week 6.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced One or More Episodes of Hypoglycemia (Symptomatic or Asymptomatic)
outcomeMeasures.description:
Hypoglycemic episodes are defined as either a fingerstick glucose

measurement of ≤70 mg/dL \[3.9 mmol/L\] with or without symptoms or symptomatic hypoglycemia.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: All patients as treated (APaT) defined as all randomized participants who received at least one dose of MK-0941 or glimepiride.

analyses.estimateComment: The estimated value represents the difference in percentages, MK-0941 minus Glimepiride.

adverseEventsModule.description: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of MK-0941 or glimepiride. Assessments during regular visits to the site (every 2 to 4 weeks).

eventGroups.title: MK-0941
eventGroups.description: All patients as treated (APaT) defined as all randomized participants who received at least one dose of MK-0941.

eventGroups.title: Glimepiride
eventGroups.description: All patients as treated (APaT) defined as all randomized participants who received at least one dose of glimepiride.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
